New Records: Glenn Phillips scored the second century of the T20 World Cup, matching the feat of South Africa's Rilee Rossouw
Key Match Events: Glenn Phillips powered to a blistering century, scoring 104 runs from 64 balls
Trent Boult spearheaded the New Zealand attack, capturing 4-13
New Zealand bowled out Sri Lanka for 102 from 19.2 overs
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand solidified their lead at the top of group one with a 65-run win over Sri Lanka
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kiwis are leading group one on five points, with England, Ireland and Australia locked on three points
Every team in group one has two games remaining
